DataElement.preferredName: Patient Physical Examination Pregnancy Breast Feeding Contraindicated Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to a contraindicated assessment regarding pregnancy, nursing etc.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Physical Examination Pregnancy Breast Feeding Contraindicated
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a contraidicated assessment regarding pregnancy, nursing etc.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:A physical examination is a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

Property.preferredDefinition: The condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body, after union of an ovum and spermatozoon. (Dorland, 27th ed):The nursing of an infant at the mother's breast.:To indicate the inadvisability of (a medical treatment, for example). (Dictionary.com)

Concepts.definition: The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth.
The nursing of an infant at the mother's breast.
State of a particular method of treatment, regimen, procedure, medication, etc. of being unsuitable and inadvisable, often because of a likely adverse reaction.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Any of the following:  Pregna
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any of the following:  Pregnant women, Nursing women, Men or women of childbearing potential who are unwilling to employ adequate contraception

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any of the following:  Pregnant women, Nursing women, Men or women of childbearing potential who are unwilling to employ adequate contraception throughout the duration of the study and for 12 weeks after treatment has ended

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any of the following: Pregnant women Nursing women Men or women of childbearing potential who are unwilling to employ adequate contraception throughout the study and for men for up to 3 months after completing treatment

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any of the following: Pregnant women, Nursing women, Men or women of childbearing potential who are unwilling to employ adequate contraception during this study and for up to 6 months after bevacizumab treatment has ended

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description:
Any of the following because this study involves an agent that has known genotoxic, mutagenic and teratogenic effects.
-	Pregnant women
-	Nursing women
-	Men or women of childbearing potential who are unwilling to employ adequate contraception.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any of the following because this study involves an investigational agent whose genotoxic, mutagenic and teratogenic effects on the developing fetus and newborn are unknown: Pregnant women, Nursing women, Men or women of childbearing potential who are unwilling to employ adequate contraception throughout the duration of the study and for 12 weeks after treatment has ended

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any of the following: Women of childbearing potential and male participants who are unwilling to employ adequate contraception during protocol treatment and for at least 6 months following treatment.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any of the Following: Pregnancy or women of childbearing potential not willing/able to use medically acceptable forms of contraception during protocol treatment or for at least 6 months following treatment.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any of the following: Pregnancy or women of childbearing potential and men who are sexually active with a woman of childbearing potential and not willing/able to use medically acceptable forms of contraception during protocol treatment and for at least 6 months following treatment.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient a pregnant or lactating women, or a sexually active male or female of childbearing potential who is not willing or able to use medically acceptable forms of contraception?

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Assessments Ind-2 2018320v1.0 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
